fault.message: Java is running very low on heap space memory.

condition.message: Running very low on heap space memory in java.

cause.message: Garbage collection is not able to reclaim enough memory in java.

resolution.message: 1) In eucalyptus.conf, locate the CLOUD_OPTS variable. 2) Check to see if -Xmx=[value] is included in the CLOUD_OPTS value. 3) If -Xmx value is not set, set it to a relatively large value. Default values are either 1GB or 1/4 of the physical memory, whichever is smaller. Set it to at least that value. (Value can be in bytes, or can be something like '64M' or '1G'. 4) If -Xmx is already set, make the value larger. 5) Restart the cloud application. 6) If after setting -Xmx to the maximum allowable value, this condition continues, it may be necessary to add more physical memory to the machine.
